newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait share slips further in anxious market.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait share slips further in anxious market.

text.p: The Kuwait Stock Exchange index dropped 30.2 points on Monday to 1,858.4 in market dominated by correction fears.
"Everyone in anxious...expecting the market to drop further," said one broker at the end of the 2-1/2 hour trading session.
The Kuwait bourse has been setting record highs in recent weeks, rising 218.4 points in October month-on-month to 1,954.2 -- a 43 percent increase from January 2.
The index fell 31.5 points on Sunday to 1,888.6 amid expectations by several market analysts of a correction, a prediction which has led to a drop in trading value.
It reached 28.56 million dinars ($95.5 million) on Monday compared to Sunday's 23 million dinars and last week's daily trading value average of 57.1 million dinars.
Trading volume continued to rise on Monday, reaching 90.6 million shares compared to 74 million on Sunday and a daily average of 180 million shares last week.
Only nationals of Gulf Arab states -- Saudi Arabia, Bahrain, United Arab Emirates, Qatar, Oman and Kuwait -- can trade on the exchange. Foreign residents can invest through mutual funds.
